feria_inicio.texto: Today the town is holding the Great Persuasion Fair.
feria_inicio.fonetica: təˈdeɪ ðə taʊn ɪz ˈhoʊldɪŋ ðə ɡreɪt pərˈsweɪʒən fɛr

feria_ambiente.texto: Everyone wants to sell, persuade, or win something.
feria_ambiente.fonetica: ˈɛvriˌwʌn wɑnts tə sɛl pərˈsweɪd ɔr wɪn ˈsʌmθɪŋ

feria_expectativa.texto: And nobody is ready for what is coming.
feria_expectativa.fonetica: ænd ˈnoʊbɑdi ɪz ˈrɛdi fɔr wʌt ɪz ˈkʌmɪŋ

don_paco_pide_favor.texto: Don Paco asks his neighbor for a little favor.
don_paco_pide_favor.fonetica: dɔn ˈpɑko æsks hɪz ˈneɪbər fɔr ə ˈlɪtəl ˈfeɪvər

don_paco_escoba.texto: Neighbor, can I borrow your broom for a moment
don_paco_escoba.fonetica: ˈneɪbər kæn aɪ ˈbɑroʊ jʊr brum fɔr ə ˈmoʊmənt

don_paco_curioso.texto: Later, Don Paco notices something odd.
don_paco_curioso.fonetica: ˈleɪtər dɔn ˈpɑko ˈnoʊtəsɪz ˈsʌmθɪŋ ɑd

vecina_amable.texto: After that small favor, the neighbor treats him more kindly.
vecina_amable.fonetica: ˈæftər ðæt smɔl ˈfeɪvər ðə ˈneɪbər trits hɪm mɔr ˈkaɪndli

explicacion_ben_franklin.texto: The Ben Franklin effect says that when someone does you a favor, they tend to like you more afterwards.
explicacion_ben_franklin.fonetica: ðə bɛn ˈfræŋklɪn ɪˈfɛkt sɛz ðət wɛn ˈsʌmˌwʌn dʌz ju ə ˈfeɪvər ðeɪ tɛnd tə laɪk ju mɔr ˈæftərwərdz

ben_franklin_razon.texto: The brain reasons: If I helped them, I must like them.
ben_franklin_razon.fonetica: ðə breɪn ˈrizənz ɪf aɪ hɛlpt ðɛm aɪ məst laɪk ðɛm

nino_galletas.texto: A kid selling cookies approaches with a smile.
nino_galletas.fonetica: ə kɪd ˈsɛlɪŋ ˈkʊkiz əˈproʊtʃɪz wɪð ə smaɪl

nino_ofrece_galleta.texto: Want to try a free cookie
nino_ofrece_galleta.fonetica: wɑnt tə traɪ ə fri ˈkʊki

adulto_prueba.texto: After trying it, the adult smiles.
adulto_prueba.fonetica: ˈæftər ˈtraɪɪŋ ɪt ði əˈdʌlt smaɪlz

nino_vende_caja.texto: Take the whole box, they're delicious
nino_vende_caja.fonetica: teɪk ðə hoʊl bɑks ðer ɑr dɪˈlɪʃəs

explicacion_pie_puerta.texto: The foot in the door technique asks for something small first.
explicacion_pie_puerta.fonetica: ðə fʊt ɪn ðə dɔr tɛkˈnik æsks fɔr ˈsʌmθɪŋ smɔl fɜrst

pie_puerta_efecto.texto: Once you say yes to the small ask, it's easier to agree to a bigger one later.
pie_puerta_efecto.fonetica: wʌns ju seɪ jɛs tə ðə smɔl æsk ɪts ˈizjər tə əˈgri tə ə ˈbɪɡər wʌn ˈleɪtər

precio_anuncio.texto: A shop advertises: Before one million, now only three hundred thousand
precio_anuncio.fonetica: ə ʃɑp ˈædvərˌtaɪzɪz bɪˈfɔr wʌn ˈmɪljən naʊ ˈoʊnli θri ˈhʌndrəd ˈθaʊzənd

explicacion_anclaje.texto: The anchoring bias makes the first number we hear stick in our minds.
explicacion_anclaje.fonetica: ði ˈæŋkərɪŋ ˈbaɪəs meɪks ðə fɜrst ˈnʌmbər wi hɪr stɪk ɪn aʊər maɪndz

anclaje_percepcion.texto: So the new price seems cheap, even if it's not that much of a bargain.
anclaje_percepcion.fonetica: soʊ ðə nu praɪs simz ʧip ˈivɪn ɪf ɪts nɑt ðæt mʌʧ əv ə ˈbɑrɡən

negociacion_silencio.texto: On another corner, two people are negotiating.
negociacion_silencio.fonetica: ɑn əˈnʌðər ˈkɔrnər tu ˈpipəl ɑr nɪˈɡoʊʃieɪtɪŋ

otro_sonrie.texto: The other just looks and smiles silently.
otro_sonrie.fonetica: ði ˈʌðər ʤəst lʊks ənd smaɪlz ˈsaɪləntli

hablador_nervioso.texto: The talker gets nervous and ends up lowering the price.
hablador_nervioso.fonetica: ðə ˈtɔkər ɡɛts ˈnɜrvəs ənd ɛndz ʌp ˈloʊərɪŋ ðə praɪs

explicacion_silencio.texto: The power of silence is real, sometimes the quiet person wins the negotiation.
explicacion_silencio.fonetica: ðə ˈpaʊər əv ˈsaɪləns ɪz ril ˈsʌmˌtaɪmz ðə ˈkwaɪət ˈpɜrsən wɪnz ðə nɪˌɡoʊʃiˈeɪʃən

maria_cliente.texto: Maria notices her customer crossing his arms.
maria_cliente.fonetica: məˈriə ˈnoʊtəsɪz hɜr ˈkʌstəmər ˈkrɔsɪŋ hɪz ɑrmz

cliente_sonrie.texto: The customer smiles and feels in sync.
cliente_sonrie.fonetica: ðə ˈkʌstəmər smaɪlz ənd filz ɪn sɪŋk

explicacion_espejo.texto: The mirroring effect happens when we subtly copy someone’s posture or gestures.
explicacion_espejo.fonetica: ðə ˈmɪrərɪŋ ɪˈfɛkt ˈhæpənz wɛn wi ˈsʌtəli ˈkɑpi ˈsʌmwʌnz ˈpɑstʃər ɔr ˈʤɛstʃərz

cancion_suena.texto: The same song plays all over the fair again and again.
cancion_suena.fonetica: ðə seɪm sɔŋ pleɪz ɔl ˈoʊvər ðə fɛr əˈgɛn ənd əˈgɛn

gente_canta.texto: By the end of the day, everyone is humming along happily.
gente_canta.fonetica: baɪ ði ɛnd əv ðə deɪ ˈɛvriˌwʌn ɪz ˈhʌmɪŋ əˈlɔŋ ˈhæpɪli

explicacion_exposicion.texto: The mere exposure effect says the more we see or hear something, the more we tend to like it.
explicacion_exposicion.fonetica: ðə mɪr ɪkˈspoʊʒər ɪˈfɛkt sɛz ðə mɔr wi si ɔr hɪr ˈsʌmθɪŋ ðə mɔr wi tɛnd tə laɪk ɪt

frutas_saludo.texto: The fruit seller calls out, Good morning Doña Rosa
frutas_saludo.fonetica: ðə frut ˈsɛlər kɔlz aʊt ɡʊd ˈmɔrnɪŋ ˈdoʊnjə ˈrosa

dona_rosa_sonrie.texto: She smiles and buys twice as much.
dona_rosa_sonrie.fonetica: ʃi smaɪlz ənd baɪz twaɪs əz mʌʧ

explicacion_nombre.texto: Hearing your own name feels good and quickly creates closeness.
explicacion_nombre.fonetica: ˈhɪrɪŋ jʊr oʊn neɪm filz ɡʊd ənd ˈkwɪkli kriˈeɪts ˈkloʊsnəs

buffet_postres.texto: At the dessert stall there are forty flavors.
buffet_postres.fonetica: æt ðə dɪˈzɜrt stɔl ðɛr ɑr ˈfɔrti ˈfleɪvərz

nadie_elige.texto: Everyone stares at the menu…and nobody chooses.
nadie_elige.fonetica: ˈɛvriˌwʌn stɛrz æt ðə ˈmɛnju ənd ˈnoʊbədi ˈʧuzɪz

explicacion_eleccion.texto: The paradox of choice shows that too many options can make us decide worse or not at all.
explicacion_eleccion.fonetica: ðə ˈpærədɑks əv ʧɔɪs ʃoʊz ðæt tu ˈmɛni ˈɑpʃənz kən meɪk ʌs dɪˈsaɪd wɜrs ɔr nɑt æt ɔl

paralisis_analisis.texto: The brain goes into analysis paralysis.
paralisis_analisis.fonetica: ðə breɪn ɡoʊz ˈɪntu əˈnæləsɪs pəˈræləsɪs

noticiero_tiburon.texto: The announcer shouts, A shark attacked a tourist
noticiero_tiburon.fonetica: ði əˈnaʊnsər ʃaʊts ə ʃɑrk əˈtækt ə ˈtʊrɪst

gente_miedo.texto: That night no one goes into the sea.
gente_miedo.fonetica: ðæt naɪt noʊ wʌn ɡoʊz ˈɪntu ðə si

explicacion_disponibilidad.texto: The availability heuristic makes us overestimate what we easily recall.
explicacion_disponibilidad.fonetica: ði əˌveɪləˈbɪlɪti daɪˈrɪstɪk meɪks ʌs ˌoʊvərˈɛstəˌmeɪt wʌt wi ˈizəli rɪˈkɔl

efecto_manada.texto: A group yells that the burgers are the best
efecto_manada.fonetica: ə ɡrup jɛlz ðæt ðə ˈbɜrgərz ɑr ðə bɛst

explicacion_bandwagon.texto: The bandwagon effect, or herd effect, happens when we copy what most people do.
explicacion_bandwagon.fonetica: ðə ˈbændˌwæɡən ɪˈfɛkt ɔr hɜrd ɪˈfɛkt ˈhæpənz wɛn wi ˈkɑpi wʌt moʊst ˈpipəl du

bandwagon_creencia.texto: We assume that if everyone does it, it must be good.
bandwagon_creencia.fonetica: wi əˈsum ðət ɪf ˈɛvriˌwʌn dʌz ɪt ɪt məst bi ɡʊd

cirujano_historia.texto: A surgeon goes in to operate on his son but says I can't I am his parent
cirujano_historia.fonetica: ə ˈsɜrʤən ɡoʊz ɪn tə ˈɑpəˌreɪt ɑn hɪz sʌn bət seɪz aɪ kænt aɪ əm hɪz ˈpɛrənt

clase_confundida.texto: The class is puzzled, How can that be two dads
clase_confundida.fonetica: ðə klæs ɪz ˈpʌzəld haʊ kæn ðæt bi tu dædz

revelacion_madre.texto: Until someone shouts, The surgeon is his mother
revelacion_madre.fonetica: ənˈtɪl ˈsʌmwʌn ʃaʊts ðə ˈsɜrʤən ɪz hɪz ˈmʌðər

explicacion_cirujano.texto: The surgeon bias shows how stereotypes shape our perception.
explicacion_cirujano.fonetica: ðə ˈsɜrʤən ˈbaɪəs ʃoʊz haʊ ˈstɛriəˌtaɪps ʃeɪp aʊər pərˈsɛpʃən

moraleja_final.texto: Everyone learned something: negotiating is not just about talking, it's about listening, watching, and understanding how the mind works.
moraleja_final.fonetica: ˈɛvriˌwʌn lɜrnd ˈsʌmθɪŋ nɪˌɡoʊʃiˈeɪtɪŋ ɪz nɑt ʤʌst əˈbaʊt ˈtɔkɪŋ ɪts əˈbaʊt ˈlɪsənɪŋ ˈwɑʧɪŋ ənd ˌʌndərˈstændɪŋ haʊ ðə maɪnd wɜrks
